result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon R Martin

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:45 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brandon R Martin in court.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Brandon R Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kees provides an update; she is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Kees as counsel of record for the defendant.

10:39 AM; Case called for Hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Defendant Brandon R Martin in court. Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he cannot afford an attorney at this time.  Court inquires if the defendant has applied at the Public Defender's office.  Defendant advises he has not.  Court advises the defendant to report to the Public Defender's office after court today to see if he qualifies for representation.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A/business located at 1700 Arthur Court, in the City and County of Waukesha, State of Wisconsin listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:52 AM  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Brandon R Martin in court.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Todd K Martens August 22, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
